image.altText: A broken door and emergency service workers outside Northland shopping centre.

props.synopsis: Authorities are searching for a person they say drove a car through a shopping centre while evading police in Melbourne's north on Wednesday afternoon.

title.children: Driver at large after driving through Melbourne shopping centre, police say

image.altText: A man wearing a biege button-up shirt looks at a computer screen while seated inside.

props.synopsis: Writer Alistair Kitchen said he was refused entry to the US last week after being grilled about his views on the Gaza conflict and articles he wrote about pro-Palestinian protests.

title.children: Australian turned away from border for drug use, US government says

image.altText: A close up photo of Erin Patterson looking over her shoulder wearing glases.

props.synopsis: Defence lawyer Colin Mandy SC urges jurors in Ms Patterson's triple-murder trial to "guard against" viewing her actions after the deadly lunch as incriminating, telling them there was no motive for her to harm her in-laws.

title.children: Erin Patterson's lawyer warns jury about 'dangerous' hindsight reasoning

image.altText: A dark brick building bearing the words "Horsham Law Courts".

props.synopsis: A 30-year-old West Australian man has been charged after allegedly fooling his family into thinking he had cancer and scammed them out of more than $2 million.

title.children: Man accused of faking cancer and scamming his family out of millions

image.altText: A young, dark-haired man in a business shirt and slacks stands outside a large building.

props.synopsis: Fua Moananu, 26, was facing a number of charges following a 2024 crash in Victoria that claimed the lives of two seasonal workers.

title.children: Charges dropped against driver involved in deadly minibus crash

image.altText: Kate Robinson

props.synopsis: Kate Robinson left her laptop on charge in her bedroom while running errands. An hour later, she returned to find her house and yoga studio engulfed in flames.

title.children: Home owner warns against charging laptops on beds after fire guts house

image.altText: A road train parked among trees on a country road.

props.synopsis: Road trains laden with hay are travelling thousands of kilometres to keep livestock alive in southern Australia amid ongoing feed shortages.

title.children: Charity foots bill to truck hay to desperate Victorian farmers

image.altText: Thousands of people gathered at the foot of Parliament House in Melbourne.

props.synopsis: A Yoorrook Justice Commissioner reached Victorian parliament after walking 500 kilometres to mark the closure of Australia’s first formal Aboriginal truth-telling inquiry.

title.children: Thousands join walk as Australian-first truth-telling inquiry ends

image.altText: A graphic imge of a farmer looking at sheep.

props.synopsis: Mental health experts warn of the dangers of spreading misinformation after unverified figures of the number of Victorian farmers who have taken their own lives circulated on social media.

title.children: Warning for MPs over 'dangerous' mental health misinformation

image.altText: Two police officers in navy uniforms and yellow vests stand beside a badly damaged blue car on sloping grass.

props.synopsis: The alleged stolen car plunged down an embankment in Epping, in Melbourne's north, leaving six teenagers with serious injuries.

title.children: Six teenagers hurt after alleged stolen car rolls near Melbourne freeway

image.altText: A crowd at an arts festival with brightly coloured cloth roofing.

props.synopsis: Victoria's eight-year-old psychedelic music and arts festival, which locked out punters at the last minute this year, goes into voluntary administration owing millions to ticketholders, contractors and employees.

title.children: Esoteric Festival bites the dust in a $2.8 million swirl of debt

image.altText: The back of a man's blue shirt

props.synopsis: Firefighters in Victoria are the latest emergency services workforce to withdraw support for those in command in the past year, with members overwhelmingly delivering a vote of no confidence in Fire Rescue Victoria's leadership.

title.children: Firefighters pass no-confidence vote in Fire Rescue Victoria's leadership

image.altText: A small possum superimposed over a black background, showing a handdrawn aerial map

props.synopsis: A Victorian timber company is using what's been dubbed a "zombie" license from 1977 to log critically endangered mountain ash forest, including the habitat of the Leadbeater's possum, which was once thought extinct.

title.children: 'Death by a thousand cuts': Possum habitat logged using 1977 'zombie' permit

image.altText: Three men wearing hi-vis and hard hats, one of them speaks at microphone

props.synopsis: The federal energy minister will announce changes to how benchmark power prices are set, aimed at cutting back how much energy retailers can hit consumers to cover costs like advertising, on Wednesday.

title.children: Federal government to change power price rules to push costs lower

image.altText: Isaac Smith and Scott Selwood after running their marathons

props.synopsis: Radio host Carrie Bickmore praises former AFL players Isaac Smith and Scott Selwood for running marathons to raise funds for brain cancer.

title.children: Bickmore pays tribute to Smith and Selwood after gruelling marathon

image.altText: One car is covered in a tarp and another is smashed on a city street

props.synopsis: The Supreme Court of Victoria has heard a man who drove into a crowd of people at Bourke Street in 2023, killing one and seriously injuring others, was mentally impaired at the time.

title.children: Man who drove into Bourke St crowd 'thought he was a devil', court hears

image.altText: A church building with a cross shrouded under branches

props.synopsis: Churches will be held vicariously liable for abuse committed by priests under new Victorian laws to be introduced to parliament by the end of the year.

title.children: Victoria to propose laws making churches vicariously responsible for abuse

image.altText: Shane Jacobson in a bright, summery shirt stands in front of the Mildura oranges mural.

props.synopsis: Data shows tourism to Victoria's north-west has dropped despite a $390,000 campaign locals say fails to capture "what Mildura is really about".

title.children: Heat on council over costly Tropical North Victoria campaign 'flop'

image.altText: Jack Sinclair wipes his nose with his jumper

props.synopsis: St Kilda and a number of other clubs are stuck in AFL no-mans land, the worst place to be as Tasmania gets set to enter the competition, and they must embrace youth before it is too late.

title.children: AFL clubs must pick a lane or risk being left behind after expansion

image.altText: A high school student poses with her mobile showing her social media applications.

props.synopsis: A bill will be introduced to state parliament today to increase the jail time for criminals who post about their offences on social media.

title.children: Criminals who 'post and boast' to face two extra years in jail in Victoria

image.altText: Ripped up roads are costly

props.synopsis: Some of Victoria's cash-strapped local councils struggle to provide the services ratepayers expect after a decade of rate capping.

title.children: Victorian councils rip up roads they can't afford to fix

image.altText: MDMA tablet

props.synopsis: The Victorian government has announced the location of the state's first permanent pill testing centre.

title.children: Permanent pill testing site announced for Fitzroy

image.altText: Greyhound racing sign that says Warrnambool.

props.synopsis: An animal welfare group says greyhound racing is riddled with systemic failures as the industry body investigates a case of seven dehydrated dogs.

title.children: Vet finds seven greyhounds from same kennel dehydrated before race

image.altText: A villa in Bali where three motobikes are parked outside and the entrance is cornered off with police tap

props.synopsis: Zivan Radmanovic was killed on Saturday when two men broke into the villa he was staying in near the Bali tourist hotspot Canggu.

title.children: Bali police retract statement over arrest in Australian man's death in Bali villa shooting

image.altText: Australian writer Alistair Kitchen stands holding a laptop he says he was denied entry to the United States

props.synopsis: Writer Alistair Kitchen was detained for 12 hours at Los Angeles International Airport, had his phone seized and was "interrogated" about his views on the conflict in the Middle East.

title.children: 'I wouldn't wish it on anyone': Melbourne man 'interrogated' at US airport

image.altText: A small bio module mounted to the outside of a lunar lander sits on the moon, with the Earth in the background

props.synopsis: While some people find it hard enough to keep their garden alive at home, an Australian team plans to send plants to the moon in the hope they will grow on the lunar surface.

title.children: The Australian scientists on a mission to grow plants on the moon

image.altText: man with moustache and beard wearing black sitting on chaise lounge at the Turner exhibition

props.synopsis: British painter Joseph Turner's profound impact on Australian landscape art is on show in an exhibition featuring his original paintings alongside the masters he inspired.

title.children: Joseph Turner exhibition showcases 'god-like figure in Australian art'

image.altText: Villawood Immigration Detention Centre

props.synopsis: The ABC understands a man charged over an alleged serious assault in Melbourne's inner west over the weekend was released from immigration detention following a 2023 High Court ruling.

title.children: Released immigration detainee charged over serious Melbourne assault

image.altText: A dark grey helicopter with the Victoria Police badge and word 'police' printed on the side hovers over blurred houses.

props.synopsis: A motorcyclist's bike, gloves and helmet were found near the site of a car and motorbike collision on the Hume Freeway near Wangaratta on Friday, and police are appealing for the rider or any witnesses to come forward.

title.children: Bike and clothing found but motorcyclist missing from Wangaratta crash site

image.altText: A woman with short hair and a blue shirt looks ahead.

props.synopsis: With more than 100,000 treatment cycles taking place yearly in Australia's growing IVF industry, those with first-hand experience say it's time for changes to increase transparency and simplify regulations.

title.children: IVF mix-ups raise questions about the rapidly growing industry

image.altText: Bottle of spirits of vodka and whisky are lined a long a shelf.

props.synopsis: Victorian councils want to retain their power of veto over new liquor outlets in country towns amid fierce debate about the links between family violence and access to alcohol.

title.children: Ninth bottle shop proposed for Swan Hill as councils lose veto power

image.altText: A white woman with short grey hair takes a selfie while hugging an Aboriginal woman in a pink dress with dark hair.

props.synopsis: Dr Margaret Niemann has been honoured for providing groundbreaking antenatal and mental healthcare in regional communities.

title.children: Trailblazing GP brought mental healthcare to communities that had none

image.altText: Energy tower with blue skies and fencing

props.synopsis: Australians struggling to pay their energy bills face 'major inconsistencies' in how retailers respond, a survey of financial counsellors has found. The energy sector is lagging behind banking and water when it comes to supporting customers in hardship.

title.children: The worst-ranked energy retailers when it comes to hardship provisions

image.altText: Shyla Heal on court for the Opals against Japan in 2024.

props.synopsis: Point guard Shyla Heal will return to the WNBL this season after announcing she has linked up with Geelong United.

title.children: Heal locks in WNBL homecoming with Geelong United

image.altText: A landscape showing steep rock formations rising up out of hilly bushland.

props.synopsis: When Hyun Park slipped while climbing in the Warrumbungles, her life depended on her 80-year-old mentor and the tactical gymnastics of a 20-hour overnight rescue mission.

title.children: Remarkable 20-hour rescue of Melbourne climber dangling unconscious 200m up a cliff
